headline: God, Not Trump, Inspired Herschel Walker to Run for Office, NFL Star Says
author: Aila Slisco
sentences: In contrast, Republican Georgia Governor Brian Kemp and Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, both frequent targets of the former president for refusing to overturn his 2020 loss to President Joe Biden, easily defeated Trump-backed candidates David Perdue and Jody Hice in their primaries.

Polls suggest that Walker, who during an interview with Atlanta's WAGA-TV last week said that he didn't know "whether President Trump said that" the 2020 election was stolen, could be set for a photo finish with incumbent Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock in November's general election.

While Walker insisted that Trump had never directly asked him if he would "run for that Senate seat," the former president did encourage the former NFL star to challenge for the seat more than five months before he officially launched his campaign.
Walker went on to say that he was initially praying "that God would bring somebody else" to run for the Republican nomination but he eventually agreed to run himself out of love for "the Lord Jesus."
Former NFL star Hershel Walker, the Republican nominee for the U.S. Senate election in Georgia later this year, has lashed out at former President Donald Trump over "taking credit" for his campaign.
Walker said that he made the decision to launch his campaign after a period of prayer, adding that he was "mad" at Trump for saying that the decision came after he had "asked" him to run.
During a recent interview on Revolt TV's Love & Respect With Killer Mike, Walker suggested that his Senate campaign was inspired by God rather than the former president.
Walker, endorsed by Trump, defeated five other GOP candidates during last week's primary election, having secured nearly 70 percent of the vote.
"One thing that people don't know is President Trump never asked me," Walker said during the interview, which was shared online Tuesday.
"Before all this started coming about, my wife and I went with Pastor Tony Evans at Oak Cliff Bible Fellowship and we went into prayer.
You know, I heard it all on television that he's going to ask Herschel, saying Herschel is going to run."
"Wouldn't it be fantastic if the legendary Herschel Walker ran for the United States Senate in Georgia?"
An average of polls from RealClearPolitics shows Walker leading Warnock by 0.5 percent as of Tuesday.
"He would be unstoppable, just like he was when he played for the Georgia Bulldogs, and in the NFL.
"I'm mad at him because he never asked but he's taking credit that he asked," he continued.
Walker's win last week was a small victory for Trump in Georgia.
Newsweek reached out to Trump's office for comment.
Trump said in statement issued on March 10, 2021.
"And I need to tell him that he never asked.
We went into prayer and I prayed about it."
He is also a GREAT person.
Run Herschel, run!"
